moves.1... e5 2. Bb2 d5 3. b5: To prevent Nc6 (the main interest of b4). A bit slow may be.
moves.5... Nxe5 6. Nxe5 Ne4: Threatening Qf6, with Qxf2#, Qxe5, and Q look at Ra1 !
moves.7. d4 Qf6 8. Nf3 Bb4+: Looks dangerous, but there is a defense
moves.10... Nxb1+:
Leave white with some material.
But Nxa2  Nbd2, Bxd2 Nxd2, and the a2 night will die.
moves.11. Qxb4 Bf5 12. Rxb1 Bxb1 13. Qxb1 O-O: ? I do not understand the point of this move, which weakens the kingside
moves.15. Be2 c5 16. bxc6 e.p. Qxc6 17. O-O Ra: Prevent Qc2 with invasion. So Bd3 instead of Be2 at move 15 was probably better
moves.18... Rfd8 19. Ne5 Qc7 20. Qb2: With the idea Rb1, but actually, it is not a very deep plan
moves.20... f6: Push the night away, but weakens the kingside. Now, I have a plan : Push h pawn to ruin the kingside and attack the king !!
moves.21. Nf3 Qc3 22. Qb1: In accordance with the plan, no queen exchange, and pressure on g6-h7
moves.23. h4 a6 24. h5 gxh5: Black underestimate white's attack. f5, hxg hxg, Nh4 Rd6 seems more solid.
moves.25. Bxh7+ Kh8 26. Bf5 Rc7 27. Nh4 b5: Try to found counter play on the queenside
moves.28... Kg8 29. Qxh5 Qd6: How to continue the attack now ?
moves.30. Qg4+ Kf7: Not Rg7, Be6  Kf8, Qxg7   ! and Nf5
moves.31. Bg6+ Kg8 32. Nf5 Qb6:
How to continue the attack now ?
If Be8 , then Kf8 and it seems under control
moves.33. g3: The rook will came in from h file.
moves.33... a5 34. Kg2 b4 35. Rh1: Threat is Be8  followed by Rh8. Rdc7 leads to mate after Bh7 , so
moves.35... Qb7: Qb7, but there is a wining continuation anyway.
moves.38. Qe6+ Kf8 39. Rh8+ Qxh8 40. Qf7#:
Thanks for looking, hope you liked it.
